intro: Trevesia sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globular trevesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, fleshy fruit that resembles a small melon, which contains numerous seeds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 4 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. Trevesia sphaerocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
